title: If Raman’s age after 15 years will be 5 times his age 5 years back, what is the present age of Raman? - Quora

response.answer_text: R={10 years old} PREMISES R+15=5(R-5) ASSUMPTIONS Let Raman's present age=R Let Raman's age after 15 years=R+15 Let Raman's age 5 years back=R-5 CALCULATIONS R+15=5(R-5) R+15=5R-25 (R-R)+15=(5R-R)-25 0+15=4R-25 (Flip the equation) 4R-25=15 4R-(25–25)=15+25 4R-0=15+25 4R=15+25 4R=40 4R/4=40/4 R=40/4 R= 10 years old PROOF If R=10 years old, then the inverse of the statement R+15=5(R-5) returns R+15/(R-5)=5 (10+15)/(10–5)=5 25/5=5 and 5=5 proves the root (zero) R=10 years old of the statement R+15=5(R-5) C.H.

Yes I can. Let us suppose Raman's current age to be = x years. 5 years back his age would have been = x - 5 15 years time his age will be = x + 15 So, his present age will be = 5(x- 5) = x + 15 5x - 25 = x + 15 4x =. 40 x = 10 So, his Current age is 10.
